result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob D Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Submit DNA sample. Write a letter of apology to Edward Wentland and send a copy to the court.

Defendant Jacob D Fisher in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 15CM730, 16CM561, and 16CM95. Sentencing recommendations agreed. Defendant made statement to the Court. Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 6 months in each case. Conditions of probation include, Submit DNA sample. $443.00 costs, each case. In 16CM95 write an apology letter to the victim E.W. and send a copy to the court. 78 days credit. In 15CM730 3 days credit, 16CM561 70 days credit.  11:20/11:43

Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
for sentence hrg on 6/6/17 @ 11:00 a.m.

Defendant Jacob D Fisher in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CM95, 15CM730, and 16CM561.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 of each case.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  All other charges are dismissed but read in for each case.  Sentencing will be held in 6 months to allow defendant to attend treatment.  In 16CM561 Atty Riek requested bond be amended to allow defendant to participate in Fond Du Lac program.  State had no objection.  Court modified the bond to $300.00 signature bond.  All other conditions remain.  New conditions that defendant comply with the residental treatment plan in Fond Du Lac.  JA will set sentencing.
